definition: devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
cold/to shiver with cold/to tremble with fear/afraid/apprehensive/strict/stern/severe/austere/awe-inspiring/imposing/majestic

sentences.chinese: 英雄可以容或者大義凜然。

sentences.english: However, Di Gong morally justified to argue without compromise.
sentences.chinese: 但是狄公大義凜然，據理爭辯毫不妥協。

definition: to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
